metadata.Title: CVE-2014-9065 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - medium.
metadata.Description:
common/spinlock.c in Xen 4.4.x and earlier does not properly handle read and write locks, which allows local x86 guest users to cause a denial of service (write denial or NMI watchdog timeout and host crash) via a large number of read requests, a different vulnerability to CVE-2014-9066.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2014-9065` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

libxen-4.4 - 4.4.1-0ubuntu0.14.04.4
libxen-ocaml - 4.4.1-0ubuntu0.14.04.4
libxenstore3.0 - 4.4.1-0ubuntu0.14.04.4
xen-hypervisor-4.1-amd64 - 4.4.1-0ubuntu0.14.04.4
xen-hypervisor-4.3-amd64 - 4.4.1-0ubuntu0.14.04.4
xen-hypervisor-4.3-armhf - 4.4.1-0ubuntu0.14.04.4
xen-hypervisor-4.4-amd64 - 4.4.1-0ubuntu0.14.04.4
xen-hypervisor-4.4-arm64 - 4.4.1-0ubuntu0.14.04.4
xen-hypervisor-4.4-armhf - 4.4.1-0ubuntu0.14.04.4
xen-system-amd64 - 4.4.1-0ubuntu0.14.04.4
xen-system-arm64 - 4.4.1-0ubuntu0.14.04.4
xen-system-armhf - 4.4.1-0ubuntu0.14.04.4
xen-utils-4.4 - 4.4.1-0ubuntu0.14.04.4
xen-utils-common - 4.4.1-0ubuntu0.14.04.4
xenstore-utils - 4.4.1-0ubuntu0.14.04.4
No subscription required

criterions.comment: xen package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.1-0ubuntu0.14.04.4').
